The HEC inputs are also in the inputs.conf
Answer is ABD. Splunk can monitor json files data

choices.C: A custom search command written in Python.
choices.B: A file input monitoring a JSON file.
choices.D: An HTTP Event Collector as receiver of data from an app.

questions.question_text: Which items below are configured in inputs.conf? (Select all that apply.)
Which of the following statements describe an HEC token? (Select all that apply.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
C. Is a GUID (globally unique identifier).
D. Can be created in Splunk Web or using REST endpoints.

choices.D: Can be created in Splunk Web or using REST endpoints.
choices.B: Can be used to download data.

questions.question_text: Which of the following ensures that quotation marks surround the value referenced by the token?

comments.content: this is the way as usual! Thanks @Ignotus

discussion.content: the reference link has the answer. A is correct. TLDR; This form sets an app name token on page load. The token value is used in a panel label and a search with the |s$ filter to wrap the value in quotation marks.
Could someone please verify the accuracy of this answer

I opt for B, since HTTP Event Collector tokens are not used in conjunction with login. They are used to authenticate requests to the HTTP Event Collector endpoint.
B is correct because HTTP Event Collector tokens authenticate requests to the HTTP Event Collector endpoint. They are passed in the Authorization header field of the HTTP request.

choices.C: A JSON field in the HTTP request.
choices.D: A password in conjunction with login.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an intended use of HTTP Event Collector tokens?
When the search/jobs REST endpoint is called to execute a search, what can be done to reduce the results size in the results? (Select all that apply.)

choices.C: Truncate the data, using selective functions.

discussion.content: Answer is BCD. Generating search commands do not reduce size of data
